title: G.O.P. Toils to Find Votes for Policy Bill as Senate Prepares to Debate
summary: New official estimates showed the bill would swell deficits while slashing health programs and insurance coverage, posing potential problems as the legislation moved forward in the Senate.

title: Senate Version of Trump’s Policy Bill Would Slash Medicaid Spending Even More
summary: Analysis from the nonpartisan Congressional Budget Office found that Republicans’ new version of the legislation would make far deeper cuts and lead to more people becoming uninsured than previous proposals.

title: G.O.P. Bill Adds Surprise Tax That Could Cripple Wind and Solar Power
summary: Wind and solar companies were already bracing for Congress to end federal subsidies. But the Senate bill goes even further and penalizes those industries.

title: After War With Israel and U.S., Iran Rests on a Knife Edge
summary: The Islamic Republic limps on after the 12-day conflict. Where will the nation go from here?

title: Israel’s Attack on Evin Prison Killed 71, Iranian State Media Report
summary: The notorious detention facility in Tehran, where dissidents and political prisoners are held, came under attack on June 23.

title: Israel’s Military Appears Poised to Expand Into Gaza City Amid Cease-Fire Calls
summary: President Trump urged Israel and Hamas to “make the deal,” but it was unclear if any significant progress has been made toward an agreement.

title: Conquering Soccer and Arming Warlords
summary: The Emirati vice president is best known as the owner of Manchester City, a top English soccer team. Behind the scenes, he has been described as the “handler” guiding his country’s secret foreign wars.

title: In 1975, Gay Moms Rarely Got Custody. So She Took Her Child Underground.
summary: Facing a court system that often saw gay parents as unfit, Georgette DuBois stole her daughter, Kara, from her estranged husband. She called it a miracle, but it didn’t feel like one to Kara.

title: Appeals Court to Consider Trump’s Use of Alien Enemies Act in Mass Deportations
summary: The case before one of the most conservative courts in the country is likely to be the first to reach the Supreme Court.

title: Trump Says He’s Found Buyers for TikTok
summary: He didn’t say who was interested in buying the app, just that it was “a group of very wealthy people.” But the Chinese government needs to approve any sale.

title: Europe Heat Wave Drives Record-High Temperatures, Prompting Health Alerts
summary: Extreme heat has gripped Europe with record-high temperatures, health alerts and wildfires, from France and Spain to Greece.

title: How Zohran Mamdani Brought New Voters to the Polls
summary: Mr. Mamdani, the likely winner of the Democratic primary for mayor of New York City, drew tens of thousands of new voters to the polls. Here’s how.

title: How Social Media Videos Fueled Zohran Mamdani’s Success
summary: The son of a filmmaker is running a visually rich campaign for mayor of New York City — and has inspired voters to make their own videos on his behalf.

title: Baseball in the Everlasting Light of Fairbanks, Alaska
summary: For more than a century, baseball teams in Fairbanks have played at midnight on the summer solstice, illuminated only by the sun.

title: She Thought Lady Gaga Bought Her Art. Then Things Got Strange.
summary: The artist Emma Webster was excited when it appeared the pop star wanted to buy one of her artworks. But it was an impostor and she has asked the F.B.I. for help.

title: A Reckless Judicial Nomination Puts the Senate to the Test
summary: Trump wants one of his lawyers to be one of his judges.

title: A Decade of Marriage Equality
summary: Readers explain what Obergefell meant to them.

title: Russia Pounds Ukraine With Drones and Missiles in One of War’s Largest Attacks
summary: The overnight attack was one of the largest on Ukraine and included strikes in the western part of the country, which is hit less often.

title: Glastonbury ‘Appalled’ by Bob Vylan’s Chant Against Israel’s Military
summary: The band Bob Vylan led a crowd in a chant of “Death, death to the I.D.F.” while performing at Glastonbury, Britain’s biggest music festival.

title: NYC Pride March Arrives Amid Growing National Backlash
summary: As millions gather on Sunday for America’s largest Pride parade, the L.G.B.T.Q. community is increasingly concerned about the pushback against transgender people.

title: Greenland Gets a Little Easier to Visit as United Starts Nonstop Flights
summary: United Airlines has started a seasonal, nonstop flight from Newark to the capital of the Arctic island that President Trump wants to acquire.
